title: Rolling - disk rolling with slipping on ramp

content.question: A disk of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math>, radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, and rotational inertia <math alttext="I equals one half M R squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>M</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math> is released from rest at the top of an incline of height <math alttext="h" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>h</mi></math>. The disk rolls to the bottom of the incline without slipping. Which of the following is a correct expression for the center of mass velocity of the disk at the bottom of the incline?

choices.label: <math alttext="The square root of four g h end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>4</mn><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="The square root of two g h end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="The square root of four thirds g h end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi></msqrt></math>
<math alttext="The square root of g h end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="The square root of four thirds g h end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mfrac><mn>4</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi>g</mi><mi>h</mi></msqrt></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
